alfredsnippet.snippet:
"Semiotics makes us aware that the cultural values with which we make sense of the world are a tissue of conventions that have been handed down from generation to generation by the members of the culture of which we are a part. It reminds us that there is nothing 'natural' about our values; they are social constructs that not only vary enormously in the course of time but differ radically from culture to culture."

- Daniel Chandler, Semiotics for Beginners
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Our Values Are Social Constructs
